body_content.explanation: a person who introduces guests and performers on a TV or radio show together with one or more other people:
examples: She's co-host of a local TV show.
My co-hosts, Emily Black and Dan Willis, are reporting from Sichuan Province.

body_content.explanation: a person, place, organization, etc. that organizes and provides the space for an event, together with one or more other people, places, organizations, etc.:
examples: Austria and Switzerland have been the co-hosts of the European event.

body_content.explanation: to introduce guests and performers on a radio or TV show together with one or more other people:
examples: She now co-hosts a morning talk show on WRKO.
For the past few years, she has been co-hosting the show with Eamonn Holmes.

body_content.explanation: to organise and provide the space for an event, together with one or more other people, places, organizations, etc.:
examples: In November last year, NASA cohosted a conference on the topic.
The Prime Minister is co-hosting the talks with Bertie Ahern, the Irish Prime Minister.
